intents.description: To capture the user’s opinion after a book recommendation and respond accordingly
This intent helps start the interaction on a positive note and guides the user toward what the chatbot can do.

examples.text: will you help me to find a book
Can you describe the book Sapiens?
Give me details of Atomic Habits
Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone summary please
Is To Kill a Mockingbird worth reading?
I want to know more about The Book Thief
Show me details for The Silent Patient

intents.description: Handles user queries where they mention the title of a specific book they want information about

values.text: I didn't understand. You can try rephrasing.
Can you reword your statement? I'm not understanding.
I didn't get your meaning.

Inspirational or Heartwarming Stories
Books that celebrate life, relationships, and personal growth.
Examples:

The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho

Wonder by R.J. Palacio

Tuesdays with Morrie by Mitch Albom

"The Ramayana is one of the greatest epics of ancient India, traditionally attributed to the sage Valmiki. It tells the story of Lord Rama’s journey, his exile, the abduction of Sita by Ravana, and the triumph of good over evil. Would you like to read a translated version, a simplified retelling, or a children’s edition?"

"The Mahabharata is one of the longest and most powerful epics of ancient India, centered on the great war between the Pandavas and the Kauravas. It contains deep philosophical insights, especially the Bhagavad Gita. Would you like a complete version, a simplified retelling, or a modern interpretation?"

The Jungle Book is a beloved collection of short stories written by Rudyard Kipling, centered around the adventures of Mowgli, a human boy raised by wolves in the Indian jungle. Alongside iconic animal characters like Baloo the bear, Bagheera the black panther, and Kaa the python, Mowgli learns the Law of the Jungle and faces the challenges of nature, survival, and identity.

The Bible is the sacred scripture of Christianity, revered by billions of people around the world. It is a collection of ancient religious writings that span centuries, offering teachings, historical narratives, poetry, laws, prophecies, and moral guidance.

The Bible is divided into two main parts:

📜 1. Old Testament (Hebrew Bible):
Contains the history of the Israelites, God's covenant with His people, and prophecies of the Messiah
2. New Testament:
Focuses on the life, teachings, death, and resurrection of Jesus Christ and the beginnings of the Christian Church.

The Palace of Illusions is a modern retelling of the Indian epic Mahabharata, told from the unique and powerful perspective of Draupadi — the fire-born princess, wife to the five Pandava brothers, and one of the most complex female characters in Indian mythology.

This novel reimagines her life not just as a queen or pawn in a war of kingdoms, but as a woman with desires, choices, pain, and strength. From her birth in fire to her secret love for Karna, and her role in the Kurukshetra war, Draupadi narrates her journey with courage, insight, and rebellion.

The book also explores her relationship with Krishna, her inner conflicts, her pride, her vulnerability, and her longing for justice and meaning.

Author: Devdutt Pattanaik
Genre: Mythological Fiction, Indian Literature, Philosophical Fiction
Published: 2008

📖 Description:
The Pregnant King is a bold and imaginative mythological novel that explores the blurred lines between gender, identity, duty, and desire in ancient India. Set in the Mahabharata era, it tells the story of King Yuvanashva, a ruler desperate for an heir. In a twist of fate, he accidentally drinks a magic potion meant for his queens—and becomes pregnant himself.

What follows is a deeply philosophical and emotionally powerful tale that questions traditional gender roles, dharma (duty), and societal expectations.

Yuvanashva’s inner conflict — "Do I become a father or a mother?" — becomes a metaphor for broader questions about identity, power, and the human experience.

🌟 Themes:
Gender identity and fluidity

Dharma (righteous duty) vs. personal truth

Power, parenthood, and transformation

Ancient Indian myths through a modern lens

📚 Why Read It?
Challenges binary ideas of gender in a historical-mythical setting

Combines rich Indian mythology with contemporary philosophical questions

Written in Devdutt Pattanaik’s accessible, insightful style with references to lesser-known stories from Hindu epics

👤 Ideal For:
Readers interested in Indian mythology with a modern twist

Those exploring LGBTQ+ themes in literature

Fans of Devdutt Pattanaik’s other mythological works (like Jaya, Sita)

Thinkers who enjoy books that challenge norms and provoke thought

Would you like suggestions for other mythological novels that explore identity, gender, or social roles, like The Pregnant King?

Author: Jane Austen
Genre: Classic Literature, Romance, Social Commentary
First Published: 1813

📖 Description:
Pride and Prejudice is one of the most beloved novels in English literature, a timeless romantic comedy that offers sharp insight into society, class, and relationships in 19th-century England.

The story follows the intelligent and spirited Elizabeth Bennet, the second of five daughters in a middle-class family, as she navigates love, pride, and social expectations. When she meets the wealthy but aloof Mr. Fitzwilliam Darcy, sparks fly — but not in the way you'd expect.

As their worlds collide, both must confront their prejudices and overcome their pride to truly understand each other.

elf-Help & Personal Growth
Books that motivate and empower the reader to improve their life.
Examples:

Atomic Habits by James Clear

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen R. Covey

You Are a Badass by Jen Sincero

Spiritual & Philosophical Inspiration
Books that explore purpose, peace, and self-awareness.
Examples:

The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho

The Power of Now by Eckhart Tolle

Biographies & Memoirs
Real-life stories of people who overcame obstacles and made an impact.
Examples:

Becoming by Michelle Obama

I Am Malala by Malala Yousafzai

Educated by Tara Westover

Classic Crime Novels
->The Maltese Falcon – Dashiell Hammett

->The Hound of the Baskervilles – Arthur Conan Doyle

Heartwarming & Uplifting Stories
Books that bring hope, comfort, and emotional warmth.
Examples:

The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse by Charlie Mackesy

The Midnight Library by Matt Haig

Tuesdays with Morrie by Mitch Albom

Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine by Gail Honeyman

Emotional Fiction (Bittersweet)
Stories that reflect on grief, love, loss, or growth—perfect for emotional release.
Examples:

A Man Called Ove by Fredrik Backman

The Fault in Our Stars by John Green

The Book Thief by Markus Zusak

Me Before You by Jojo Moyes

Horror Fiction
Stories with supernatural elements, fear, and psychological terror.
Examples:

The Shining by Stephen King

Mexican Gothic by Silvia Moreno-Garcia

The Haunting of Hill House by Shirley Jackson

upernatural Suspense
Chilling tales with ghostly or paranormal elements.
Examples:

The Turn of the Screw by Henry James

Lock Every Door by Riley Sager

Dark Mystery or Crime
Crime stories with a grim or eerie tone.
Examples:

In the Woods by Tana French

The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo by Stieg Larsson

Before I Go to Sleep by S.J. Watson

💪 Types of Books to Suggest for a Motivational Mood:
Self-Help & Personal Development
Practical and mindset-changing books that boost motivation and confidence.
Examples:

Atomic Habits by James Clear

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen R. Covey

You Are a Badass by Jen Sincero

Biographies & Memoirs of Inspiring People
Real-life journeys of people who overcame challenges or achieved greatness.
Examples:

Becoming by Michelle Obama

Can't Hurt Me by David Goggins

Long Walk to Freedom by Nelson Mandela
